perturbation.original_text:
BETWEEN:
VGrab Asia Ltd. (hereinafter called as the “VAL”), located at Room E, 6th Floor, Eastern Commercial Center, 397 Hennessy Road, Hong Kong.
AND:
Mr. Zheng Qing, Mr. Gu Xianwin and Ms. Chen Weijie (hereinafter called as the "Developer"), a group
of private software developers individuals’ lead and coordinated by Ms. Chen Weijie with its operations in
P.R.China.
And hereinafter, the parties hereto shall be referred to as “Party” or “Parties”.
perturbation.changed_text:
BETWEEN:
VGrab Asia Ltd. (hereinafter called as the “VAL”), located at Room E, 6th Floor, Eastern Commercial Center, 397 Hennessy Road, Hong Kong.
AND:
Mr. Zheng Qing, Mr. Gu Xianwin and Ms. Chen Weijie (hereinafter called as the "Software Provider"), a group
of private software developers individuals’ lead and coordinated by Ms. Chen Weijie with its operations in
P.R.China.
And hereinafter, the parties hereto shall be referred to as “Party” or “Parties”.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Developer' is changed to 'Software Provider'. While seemingly synonymous, this introduces ambiguity as 'Developer' has specific implications related to code creation and maintenance as outlined in the agreement. Using 'Software Provider' opens the possibility that their role is broader and less defined, potentially impacting liability for bugs and ongoing support responsibilities as detailed later in the document.

perturbation.original_text: Being Developer of the project, Developer will be responsible and liable for the product’s business compliance with WeChat Mini Program and Payment guidelines.
perturbation.changed_text: Being the Service Provider of the project, the Software Provider will be responsible for advising on business compliance with WeChat Mini Program and Payment guidelines.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Developer' to 'Service Provider' in this context significantly alters the responsibility. The original text explicitly states the 'Developer' is 'responsible and liable' for business compliance. The modified version states that the 'Software Provider' only 'advises' on business compliance. This creates a contradiction because the responsibilities are not the same and dilutes the 'Service Provider' responsibilities compared to those of the 'Developer'.
perturbation.location: Page 2, WeChat’s Mini Program and WeChat Pay Compliance

perturbation.original_text:
VAL shall, in the event of Developer committing any breach of any of the terms and conditions of this agreement or for any other reason considered as sufficient, be entitled to terminate this agreement by giving two (2) weeks’ notice in writing and it is applicable only when the project is not completed. If
the customer terminates the agreement, then VAL shall compensate the Developer up to the date of
termination with a fee calculated on Pro-rata basis. Developer may also terminate this Agreement by
giving two (2) weeks’ notice in writing to VAL. It is applicable only when the project is not completed.
In case Developer terminates the agreement, it shall handover the entire project related IPR, work
done till date to VAL.
perturbation.changed_text:
VAL shall, in the event of the Software Provider committing any breach of any of the terms and conditions of this agreement or for any other reason considered as sufficient, be entitled to terminate this agreement by giving two (2) weeks’ notice in writing and it is applicable only when the project is not completed. If
the customer terminates the agreement, then VAL shall compensate the Team up to the date of
termination with a fee calculated on Pro-rata basis. The Lead may also terminate this Agreement by
giving two (2) weeks’ notice in writing to VAL. It is applicable only when the project is not completed.
In case the designated expert terminates the agreement, they shall handover the entire project related IPR, work
done till date to VAL.
perturbation.explanation: Here, the term 'Developer' is now replaced by the terms 'Software Provider', 'Team', 'Lead', and 'Designated expert'. These multiple terms introduces contradiction and lack of clarity. If the contract is breached, it is unclear whether the 'Software Provider', 'Team', 'Lead', or 'Designated expert' that would be held liable.
